section: TERM OF CONTRACT The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****].
explanation: The contract specifies a term of years and months commencing September 1, 2004, but the exact termination date is redacted. This omission makes it impossible to determine the agreement's total duration and creates ambiguity about when obligations end. The redaction of this key term introduces a structural flaw which creates ambiguity in text and can be categorized in categories 7 and 9.

section: CONSULTANT shall achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows:
explanation: The clause mandates a minimum number of tour events Consultant must participate in and sets a penalty for falling short. However, the specific minimum number of events is redacted, making the obligation vague. This leads to ambiguity about the exact performance standard required, and without a clear performance requirement, the repayment clause is difficult to enforce. This is an in-text contradiction and an omission in text.

section: FAILURE TO PLAY Notwithstanding any other paragraph of this Agreement, in the event that CONSULTANT dies or is unable to play tour golf at all, ADAMS GOLF may terminate this Agreement on thirty (30) days' written notice. Upon such termination, CONSULTANT and/or CONSULTANT'S estate shall be required to repay ADAMS GOLF for that period of the Agreement not performed by CONSULTANT. The repayment amount shall be calculated in the same way as repayment is calculated under paragraph 8A.
explanation: This section outlines the consequences of the Consultant being unable to play tour golf, including death, and requires repayment to ADAMS GOLF for the unperformed period. However, the calculation of this repayment is linked to paragraph 8A, which also contains a redacted number. This redaction makes the method of calculating the repayment amount unclear and unenforceable.
